scenes.location: A dimly lit top landing and staircase
scenes.summary: Dorian and Basil ascend silently in the night, with the lamp casting shifting shadows and a rising wind rattling windows. At the top landing, Dorian sets down the lamp, locks a door, and hints that he is about to reveal the secret of his life to Basil—the one man entitled to know everything about him.

scenes.location: A forsaken, dust-covered room filled with antiquated objects
scenes.summary: Inside a long-neglected chamber, Dorian lights a half-burned candle to reveal a setting up for his disclosure. The room, furnished only with faded tapestries, a curtained picture, and sparse relics, immediately sets an eerie tone. Dorian’s invitation for Basil to draw back the curtain preludes a deeper, disturbing revelation.

scenes.location: The same secret room, centered around a canvas on the table
scenes.summary: In a moment of dramatic unveiling, Basil is horrified to see on the canvas a ghastly, yet strangely beautiful, image of Dorian’s face. As Basil struggles between shock and revulsion, a tense dialogue unfolds about vanity, youth, and the nature of the soul. Dorian explains the origins of the portrait—one tied to his early days and a wish made in his youth—while both men confront the implications of a life consumed by beauty and hidden sins.

scenes.location: Within the secret room, near the table and chair
scenes.summary: A sudden, violent shift occurs when Dorian is overcome by an uncontrollable surge of hatred for Basil, seemingly inspired by the reviled image on the canvas. Seizing a forgotten knife, Dorian brutally attacks Basil—stabbing him repeatedly in a frenzy of murderous emotion—until Basil is reduced to a motionless, grotesque figure on the table.

scenes.location: Transitioning from the secret room to the balcony
scenes.summary: After committing the murder, Dorian methodically leaves the crime scene. He inspects Basil’s lifeless form—disturbingly resembling a peaceful slumber despite the violence—and then steps out onto the balcony. There, he surveys the eerie nocturnal urban scene: fog lifting, police on patrol, and strange passers-by, all contributing to the chilling mood as he internalizes his deed.

scenes.location: Throughout the mansion, including the library and hallways
scenes.summary: In the aftermath of the murder, Dorian carefully covers his tracks. He retrieves a curious Moorish lamp and conceals personal disguises within a secret press in the library, all while calculating his next moves. A conversation with his drowsy valet confirms Basil’s unexplained departure, and as Dorian reviews the time on his watch, he turns to the Blue Book—a signal of his intent to contact a man named Alan Campbell to aid in further erasing evidence of his guilt.
